thread.title: Former Liverpool striker El-Hadji Diouf confirms he intends to go into politics in Senegal
thread.title_full: Former Liverpool striker El-Hadji Diouf confirms he intends to go into politics in Senegal

author: Liam Corless
title: Former Liverpool striker El-Hadji Diouf confirms he intends to go into politics in Senegal
text:
El-Hadji Diouf has plans to go into politics (Photo: CW PicDesk)     
Former Liverpool striker El-Hadji Diouf has confirmed his intention to go into politics. 
The 36-year-old was never much of a role model on the pitch but he will hope to carry himself in a better light when he attempts to become an MP in Senegal. 
Diouf revealed he has scrapped plans to into management because a career in politics is more appealing to him. 
"My future is defined. In the next two years I will be joining politics, because I know from that point I can change a lot in football," Diouf said. Diouf has always been a controversial figure (Photo: WENN) 
"I have a lot of passion for politics, and I have people in Senegal who are mentoring me. That is the future for me, because a lot of Senegalese people are able to listen to me. 
"I took high-level coaching courses, but decided not to continue since I have better plans on things I want to do. 
"But I am always available to advise my team [Senegal] whenever called upon." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
